page.title: 08PAINSWICK HOUSE
page.content: Painswick House was built by the Hyett family in the 1730s, in Cotswold stone. It was originally nearly square, with high ceilings, as Mr Hyett suffered from asthma,and he thought that high ceilings would help him breathe more easily. Mr Hyett called the house "Buenos Ayres". In 1830, two new wings were built onto the existing house. These were the entrance hall and the green dining room. Its present owner is Lord Dickinson who leases Painswick House to Baroncino de Piro. Altogether, Painswick House has fifty six rooms, but only eight are seen by the public, the rest being used by the family. The library has bookshelves on three sides of the room, holding some four thousand books. The drawing room has hand-painted Chinese wallpaper,which
